title: Driver (Part-time)
description:
**Do you want to work in a friendly, professional and supportive organization? If so, COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Community Hope is looking for a part-time driver (flexible 20 hrs per week, Mon-Fri) to transport consumers to and from community appointments, provides courier assistance between program sites and corporate office, assists with community delivers and pick-ups.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* Transports consumers to and from residences in a safe, courteous manner.
* Demonstrates awareness of sensitivity to the needs of the consumers.
* Reports observations about changes in consumers to the Program Director or Assistant Program Coordinator.
* Maintains consumer confidentiality in all interactions with other residents.
* Follows all emergency procedures such as vehicle accidents, medical emergencies, crisis intervention, fire and/or smoke, police emergency, AED/ First Aid, etc. as per the Agency’s Policy and Procedure Manual.
* Ensures agency vehicle is kept in good condition.
* Informs supervisor of any problems with vehicle.
* Completes vehicle inspection reports and coordinates vehicle maintenance as needed.
* Maintains accurate mileage and transportation logs.
* Maintains up to date list of consumer’s addresses, phone numbers and attendance.
* Assists staff by performing non-clinical tasks as delegated by their supervisor.
* Uphold the highest ethical and professional standards in adherence with our Code of Conduct & Ethics.

**Qualifications**


* High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Some prior mental health/human service experience preferred.
* Valid driver’s license with a good driving record.


VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Request Priority Protected Veteran Referral. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Contact.

  

**~We encourage people of all backgrounds and identities to apply including Native American, people of color, women, LGBTQ+, people of all abilities, veterans and veteran spouses.~**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Counselor (Part-time)
description:
At Ebb Flow Grow, we are a boutique private practice where we make sure the environment is calm, welcoming, and deeply individualized. Our clients get the best care and we believe in quality over quantity when it comes to giving the best care possible. Our consistent referrals and waitlist reflect the reputation in our community and the quality of care our clients receive. We are looking to add someone who can round out the team and deliver the best care possible to our community. We care deeply, make it fun, and keep it professional. While we offer flexible hybrid hours, in-person session offerings are required for all applicants.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide individual and family counseling sessions to clients  
- Conduct assessments and develop treatment plans based on client needs  
- Implement evidence-based therapeutic interventions to address mental health concerns  
- Collaborate with interdisciplinary team members to coordinate care and ensure comprehensive treatment  
- Monitor client progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records and documentation  
- Participate in case conferences and team meetings to discuss client progress and treatment strategies  
-Maintain current CEU trainings as relevant to client population

Qualifications:  
- Master's degree in Counseling or related field  
- Valid NJ licensure (LPC/LCSW)  
- Experience working with diverse populations, specifically adolescents and teens  
- Knowledge of mental health counseling theories, techniques, and interventions  
- Strong interpersonal skills and ability to establish rapport with clients  
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Ability to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team  
- Proficiency in using electronic health records systems  
- Understanding of ICD-9 coding for accurate diagnosis and billing purposes

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may be required to perform other duties as assigned by their supervisor.

\\*\\*You can make your own hours based on office space availability but they must include hours that are either "after school" or weekends to accommodate school aged children/teens as needed.\\*\\*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $65.00 - $125.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Medical Specialty:

* Pediatrics

Schedule:

* After school
* Choose your own hours
* Evening shift
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* Sparta, NJ 07871: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Sparta, NJ 07871

title: Food Service Associate, Food & Nutrition/Harlem - Part Time (20 Hours/Week)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**


NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Purpose of Position:


Under supervision, with some latitude for independent initiative and judgment, is responsible for obtaining patient meal order selections and for the delivery of meals to patients, including the set-of up and loading of meal trays onto carts, inspection and transportion of meals to assigned rooms, collection and return of empty trays and/or food carts, and performance of other related tasks, as required.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

* Ensures handheld tablet is fully operational prior to visiting patients and obtaining meal order selections.
* Greets patients; discusses and obtains their menu selections for the next day’s meals, adhering to dietary restrictions (as applicable); and confirms and inputs patients’ choices at the bedside into a handheld tablet.
* Checks patients’ trays for allergens and special requests; proper reheating; and accuracy, ensuring all items on tray ticket are present; and adds hot beverages and additional items before service to patients, as needed.
* Makes additional rounds to ensure selections have been received from all patients, as appropriate.
* In adherence with meal time schedules and infection control guidelines, delivers meal trays via carts to assigned units, uses two patient identifiers and patient scripting when passing trays or food to patients, and collects soiled trays to return to the kitchen area for cleaning.
* Delivers nourishments and enteral feeding, and assembles and delivers late trays, as needed.
* Engages in service recovery to address patient complaints, whenever possible, including delivering additional items to patients, in keeping with their diet restrictions.
* Effectively communicates and collaborates with patients, and the interdisciplinary team to resolve any concerns regarding patients’ understanding of menu selections.
* Reviews diet orders and prepares a list of patients that were not seen and need to be visited by the next shift.
* Completes daily service satisfaction rounds, and enters results of service satisfaction rounds into a computer program, such as Experiencia or a similar system.
* Enters pertinent information obtained from patients into CBORD, EPIC, and/or other record systems, and periodically reviews patient menus, to ensure preferences, selections and allergens are reflected.
* Assists with the tabulation of statistics and prepares menu related reports, as requested by supervisors, managers or dietitians.
* Under supervision, assists with assimilation of new food service staff in the department, as needed.
* Assists with answering phones, processing changes in the computer system(s), and performing other related tasks, as needed.


This is a part time - 20 hour/week position; will include working weekends and holidays.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. High School Diploma or its educational equivalent; and six (6) months of full-time satisfactory experience working in a hotel, restaurant, hospitality, customer service or food service; and  

2. Completion of an NYC Health + Hospitals food service training program within three (3) months of appointment.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

description:
Sterling Farms Golf Course is looking to hire a Driving Range Attendant to work evenings. This is a seasonal part-time position. Applicants must be willing to monitor range activity, make change as needed, cleaning of the range office & more basic duties. Individual hired will be trained and course perks are available.

Job Type: Part-time

* Employee discount

* Evening shift

Shift availability:

* Night Shift (Required)

title: Supervisor, Social and Programmatic Investment
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is a full-service media agency with capabilities and expertise across all channels and disciplines. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the #1 media buying network in the Americas and #2 globally. As “The ROI Agency,” Zenith’s expertise lies in driving real, tangible business outcomes, not just media metrics, that will have a measurable effect on our clients’ business. Every investment we make has an ROI mindset—not just for our clients, but for our agency at large. We’re focused on driving the maximum value for our people, our capabilities and our media investments for some of the world’s leading brands.

 **Job Description** **Overview:**  

This position requires a highly motivated person to assist in the day-to-day execution of a(n) account(s). The Supervisor will be responsible for activating digital strategic plan development and all aspects of implementation. This individual will learn and embody Zenith’s vision of Live ROI as a mantra and manage several direct reports.

**Role Objectives:**

* Assist with planning and implementation for client accounts across Programmatic and Social campaigns for a Pharmaceutical client
* Plays a leading role in all aspects of campaign management including, campaign setup, vendor liaison and reporting
* Training/Support for Assistant Planners in billing, reporting, trafficking, analytics and research
* Complete campaign management deliverables through hands-on keyboard tasks while managing ad hoc requests
* Assist in presentation of data, insights and media to clients
* Intimate knowledge of consumer habits & touchpoints, i.e. magazine, digital mobile, social, video
* Craft knowledgeable and relevant POVs that assess media opportunities and place appropriate value
* Manage Vendor Billing: insertion orders, monthly billing reports, discrepancy resolution, and reconciliations
* Assist supervisor in negotiation of Buys, Makegoods, Positioning, Value Add Negotiations
* Draw actionable insights based off platform and third-party data through reporting dashboards
* Build relationships with vendors to analyze value and applicability of media vehicles for client media plan
* Create dynamic presentations that effectively communicate to our clients
* Maintain a knowledge of all ad serving platforms: GCM
* Prepare and deliver buying and or digital trafficking specs and guidelines
* Continuously search for opportunities to be positive and to share the positive side to every situation

  

**Qualifications** **Minimum Qualifications:**

* B.A. or B.S. in Marketing, Advertising or related field
* 3+ years of digital media buying/planning experience
* Experience planning digital campaigns for products in both the B2C space and ability to confidently present these to clients both on the phone and in-person
* Must have excellent verbal/written communication skills, interpersonal skills, detail-orientation, follow-though skills
* Must have strong analytical, research, and quantitative skills
* Must be hard-working, resourceful and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, formulas, v-lookup, conditional formats, pivot tables, etc.
* Must possess/develop a strong understanding of the pharmaceutical marketplace including awareness of key publishers, products and trends
* Experience in Meta and TikTok required; Snapchat, Reddit, Linkedin and TTD preferred as well.
* Experience with Prisma and DCM preferred
* Experience with Research tools such as Nielsen, Comscore preferred

 **Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $70,000 - $90,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/8/2024.

title: Nurses Aide (Part-Time/Weekends Only)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Purpose of Position:**


Under the direct supervision of a Registered Professional Nurse or other licensed nurse, the Nurse Aide is responsible for providing routine daily nursing care to assigned patients, ensuring their safety and well-being in accordance with all applicable laws and regulation.

**Responsibilities:**

* Obtains and records vital signs (temperature, pulse, respirations, blood pressure, pulse oximeter), weight, height, intake and outake and informs the Registered Nurse of findings.
* Prepares patient for examination and/or special procedures and remains with patient during procedure if needed.
* Observes patient's condition, mental state and social behavior and report observations to the Registered Nurse.
* Prepares patient for meals and assists with feeding if necessary. Distributes nutritional supplements to patients and records on intake & output sheets.
* Assists and accompanies patient in admitting, discharges and transfer processes, assuring comfort and safety.
* Assist patient in activities of daily living.
* Transports and accompanies patient to and from unit when necessary.
* Keeps unit, utility rooms, treatment rooms and storage rooms in a neat and orderly condition. Keeps dressing cart and clean utility room well stocked with supplies at times. Checks supplies for expiration dates, including surgical supplies.
* Performs AM and PM care.
* Performs all other duties as assigned by Supervisor and/or Designee.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Graduation from elementary school.  

2. Successful completion of a basic skills training program for Nurse Aides, or its equivalent.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: LPN – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated **LPN Supervisor** to oversee, mentor and nurture a team of nurses, HHA's, resident care aides and medication technicians in the busy Wellness/Resident Services Center of our luxury assisted living community. Acting as the shift supervisor in the absence of the Director, you will provide caring and attentive help to residents in managing their activities of daily living (ADLs) as well as in the administration of their medications — all while leading the team in caring for residents with skill and genuine kindness. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care and professionalism you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Director of Wellness
* Must have staff supervisory and medication oversight experience, preferably in an assisted living, nursing home or similar environment
* You must have an active NY LPN certification and be driven by a genuine desire to improve the quality of life of our residents
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be caring, reliable and observant with an understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders
* It's essential to excel in prioritizing, multi-tasking and working independently
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Resident Care Assistant / HHA – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* NY-Certified Nursing Assistant, Personal Care Attendant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

title: Housekeeper- Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


As a luxury assisted living community, we operate much like a high-end hotel. And that means delivering the ultimate experience in guest services and hospitality every day and in every way. We are seeking experienced, responsible and thorough **Housekeepers** to create and maintain a clean, comfortable and safe environment for our residents. You will not only maintain resident apartments, restrooms, common areas, as well as office and surrounding areas clean according to housekeeping standards and procedures, but always with a friendly, courteous and positive attitude. You will often come into contact with residents, resident families, other guests and team members, and we expect those encounters to be pleasant and professional. In this role you will be cleaning assigned areas of the community in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Housekeeping. The loving care, attention to detail and great customer service you bring to housekeeping are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

**Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* A pleasant and courteous demeanor when dealing with peers, supervisors, guests, residents and management
* Must be very swift yet thorough with cleaning practices
* Experience providing cleaning services in the restaurant, healthcare, hospital, hotel, hospitality or similar industry is a plus
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred
* Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment while dealing with a demanding customer
* Must be able to communicate in English
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and positive in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

title: Lifeguard
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


In support of the extraordinary care services and luxury living amenities we provide for our residents at The Bristal, we are seeking experienced, dedicated and upbeat **Lifeguards** to maintain a safe recreational and therapeutic environment for our residents in the outdoor pool. We open our pool on Memorial Day Weekend and it stays open until Labor Day Weekend, so this will be a seasonal position for the summer. But we are starting to recruit candidates now in preparation of our opening — and for the right individuals, this can be a fun and personally rewarding experience. In addition to being especially watchful of residents at the pool, you will also, at times, be helping them get in and out. On days when the pool is closed or there is inclement weather, you may be asked to help out in assisting with daily activities in the recreation department, as well. In this position, you will come into direct contact with residents who choose to call The Bristal home. So, above all, we look for professionalism, but also a kind and patient spirit. The loving care and attention you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general safety and wellbeing of our residents during the summer.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available

**The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:**

* Must have an unexpired license to lifeguard in the state of New York
* Be a personable, outgoing, caring, cheerful and fun individual
* Ability to create positive interactions with the residents
* Dependable, reliable and flexible to help out in other areas as needed

description:

You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


As a luxury assisted living community, we operate much like a high-end hotel. And that means delivering the ultimate experience in guest services and hospitality every day and in every way. We are seeking experienced, responsible and thorough **Housekeepers** to create and maintain a clean, comfortable and safe environment for our residents. You will not only maintain resident apartments, restrooms, common areas, as well as office and surrounding areas clean according to housekeeping standards and procedures, but always with a friendly, courteous and positive attitude. You will often come into contact with residents, resident families, other guests and team members, and we expect those encounters to be pleasant and professional. In this role you will be cleaning assigned areas of the community in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Housekeeping. The loving care, attention to detail and great customer service you bring to housekeeping are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

**Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* A pleasant and courteous demeanor when dealing with peers, supervisors, guests, residents and management
* Must be very swift yet thorough with cleaning practices
* Experience providing cleaning services in the restaurant, healthcare, hospital, hotel, hospitality or similar industry is a plus
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred
* Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment while dealing with a demanding customer
* Must be able to communicate in English
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and positive in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Waitstaff – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

title: Director of Housekeeping
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a caring and qualified individual to serve as **Director of Housekeeping.** The ideal candidate will be thorough and meticulous and will pay extraordinary attention to detail in maintaining the highest standards of housekeeping excellence at our beautiful and luxurious community.


The Director of Housekeeping is a working supervisor role. You will be responsible for planning, organizing, developing and directing overall Housekeeping and Laundry operations in compliance with all government and company standards and guidelines. In this position, you will be required to inspect, maintain and assure that the highest degree of resident quality and comfort is achieved at all times.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Scheduling team members to ensure sufficient service and coverage while ensuring working hours remain within budget
* Hiring and scheduling team members of the Housekeeping Department (Housekeepers, Porters and Laundry Assistants)
* Inspecting and evaluating the physical condition of all areas of the building and coordinating with the Maintenance Department for any needed repairs
* Inspecting all work in progress completed by team members or external contractors, while maintaining cleanliness checklists
* Training team members and providing monthly in-services support for staff
* Maintaining strict inventory levels and ordering supplies as needed
* Keeping all files and records consistent with the seamless functioning of the department
* Performing regular inspections of resident apartments and areas for sanitation, safety and proper performance of assigned tasks
* Overseeing the shampooing of rugs for both resident and common areas
* Performing cleaning tasks in times of emergency or team member shortages
* Ensuring proper safety and security regarding resident belongings and items used in executing housekeeping and laundry functions


Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat).

**Qualifications:**

* Two (2) years' experience as a supervisor in housekeeping and laundry operations
* Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Possess leadership abilities and have good communication skills
* Ability to converse with team members, residents and their families in English
* Bilingual (Spanish/English) a plus

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage

title: Service Coordinator
company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy and Autism Services
description:
**Our Ideal Service CoordinatorCandidate:**


Are you a dependable and organized person looking for a place to contribute to something meaningful? Do you have a passion for helping others and impacting lives? Do you enjoy task-focused work and following processes to get the job done the right way?


If this sounds like you, apply today!


Founded in 1995, Achieve Beyond nationally meets the needs of children by providing the highest quality of pediatric therapy and autism services. Our providers and administrative staff are dedicated to our mission of helping children and families and we are looking for smart, innovative, and driven candidates to join our team.Achieve Beyond is centered around our culture of collaboration and support to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards.

**Job Summary**:We are looking to hire aService Coordinator tojoin our growing Melville, Long Island team.The**Service Coordinator**will manage and oversee the process involved in assisting families enrolled in the Early Intervention Program (ages birth to 3). The Service Coordinator combines the traditional case management activities of organizing and coordinating needed services with the philosophy of family-centered care. Building and strengthening relationships is of the utmost importance while adhering to the timelines and procedures set forth by the counties and NYSguidelines.


Responsibilities:

* Oversight and management of an Early Intervention caseload of 45-55cases.
* Timely follow-up on cases upon assignment.
* Monitor ongoing services and therapist performance for a number of children including Special Education, Speech Therapy, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Autism Services.
* Assisting families in identifying available evaluation or service providers.
* Work independently and meet the timeliness of all paperwork submissions and implementation of NYS and NYC Regulations and Policy.
* Educating families about advocacy services.
* Coordinating services with medical and health care providers.
* Facilitating the development of a transition plan to the preschool and other services when appropriate.
* Navigates through web-based portals and customized database independently with minimal supervision, by updating and uploading necessary information and documents for every child.
* Conducts field work with the families as needed such as home visits, office meetings at regional or public location upon family request.
* Documents and submits all activity on a daily basis with accurate information and meets the unit requirement.
* Attend monthly Supervision meetings for training and continuous development.
* Other duties as assigned by manager.

**Our Mission:**


At Achieve Beyond: We believe that all children have potential. We are guided by the mission to support children with special needs to Achieve Beyond their current abilities. We are always striving for continuous improvement by setting goals and measuring performance. It is the reason we will succeed together.

**Requirements:**

* Must have a **Bachelor's degree in a health or human service field**.
* Strong computer skills are required as well as knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
* Self-motivated individual who will be able to work independently.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills.
* Can multi-task and meet multiple deadlines.
* Must have the set-up to work from home if and when needed.
* Willing to travel around the counties for cases
* Bilingual Spanish a plus

**Physical Requirements:**

* Occasionally ascends/descends stairs going to, while at, or leaving work location or facilities traveled to for work events.
* Occasionally moving and/or lifting objects at work weighing up to 20 pounds such as files or copy paper.
* Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of time up to 90% of the work day working on a computer/electronic device.
* The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).
* The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

**Benefits Include:**

* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, and 401 with employer match
* Short- and long-term disability coverage as well as life, flex spending, and commuter benefits
* Paid time off, sick time, and holiday pay
* Various Employee Discounts on Entertainment and Equipment
* Educational reimbursement and referral bonuses
* Structured initial training
* Monthly administrative events and so much more!
* **Compensation:**Full-time hourly non-exempt $21 per hour
* **Hours:**Monday-Friday 8:30am-5:00pm or 9:00am-5:30pm Must Be Willing To Work Overtime As Needed. This position is in office.

**Job Description is Subject to Change.**

***This job description is subject to change at any time.***
------------------------------------------------------------

***Achieve Beyond provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type regarding race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, caregiver status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are an individual with a disability requesting accommodation for the application process, please contact us for assistance.***
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
company_description: Achieve Beyond is a national growing pediatric therapy and educational company providing autism, ST, OT, and PT services.

description:

Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking a friendly, professional, organized and, above all, compassionate **Lead Server** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's because they've been trained and led well in performing promptly, accurately and courteously at all times. That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as the Lead Server of the Waitstaff, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Helping the Dining Room Manager prepare work schedules for Dining Room personnel
* Assigning waitstaff and bus staff to their stations on each shift
* Ensuring all dining room systems are functional before, during and after meals
* Monitoring food delivery, table satisfaction and bussing procedures continually
* Maintaining safety standards at all times
* Logging records of guest checks
* Overseeing cleanliness of dining room and kitchen areas assigned to waitstaff
* Participating in offsite events, holiday parties and special onsite events
* Performing other duties as assigned by the Dining Room Manager or Director of Food Service

**Must be able to work Tuesday - Saturday 11am - 7pm.**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Willing to wait on tables and run a station
* Remain friendly and courteous to residents and fellow team members
* Participate as a team player, always with a positive attitude
* Able to carry a tray of about 30 pounds on shoulder
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor

title: Concierge Greeter – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


As a luxury assisted living community, we operate much like a high-end hotel. And that means delivering the ultimate experience in guest services and hospitality every day and in every way. We are seeking an experienced, well-polished and upbeat **Concierge Greeter** to create an exceptional first impression of our community for those who visit our busy front desk. The attitude, demeanor and knowledge you exhibit in this key resident- and guest-facing position must reflect the excellence of our service and the core values of our brand. You will be in direct contact with residents, resident families, other guests and team members. So, at all times, we expect to you be friendly, courteous and positive, ensuring these encounters are always pleasant and professional. In this role you will be essential in representing the personality of The Bristal. The loving care, attention to detail and superior customer service you bring to your responsibilities as Concierge Greeter are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).


Additional responsibilities include:

* Answering and redirecting incoming calls with the utmost in professionalism and positivity
* Taking accurate and courteous phone messages and rapidly and patiently responding to requests by residents
* Greeting all visitors warmth and kindness as they enter the community and completing information cards on all appropriate inquiries
* Responding to all resident, guest and team member inquiries in a polite and timely fashion
* Ensuring all emergencies are handled promptly and appropriately
* Keeping the front desk sign in/ sign out logs accurate and up to date
* Performing basic computer data entry as needed


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Clear and confident speaking voice, both in person and over the phone
* Cheerful, upbeat, positive and professional demeanor
* Must be alert and attentive to details, situation and emergencies
* Strong but patient and pleasant communication skills
* Familiarity with MS Office (Excel, Word and Outlook) preferred
* Able to communicate fluently in English, both orally and in written communications
* Must always be respectful and polite to residents, guests and fellow team members
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule

title: Lifestyle Coordinator – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on **Lifestyle Coordinator** to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

description:

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Title
Executive Assistant
Job Description
I. Job Summary | *Major goals and objectives.*
Dotdash Meredith is looking for a highly organized Executive Assistant to support our Chief Technology Officer and Chief Product Officer. The role requires you to be self-motivated, flexible, and nimble since we are a fast-paced, high-growth digital media company. You are responsible for maintaining multiple calendars, scheduling meetings with internal and external parties, coordinating travel, managing T&E, and tending to any other needs that pop up. This role reports directly into the executive you support.
II. Essential Job Functions* Expertly manage day-to-day workflows, providing best in class support throughout back-to-back meeting days; often with little oversight and making judgements based on known priorities to the leaders you support
* Proactively check in, anticipating needs and offering to take things over
* Manage multiple calendars, scheduling all meetings and personal engagements with expert finesse, and overseeing them through to completion


 Clearly communicate calendar shifts to your executive’s guests and internal stakeholders Attend meetings when needed, taking notes on follow up items to track to help your leader drive completion of key deliverables and follow up on outstanding items* Coordinate all travel arrangements including booking airfare, hotels, transportation, and reservations for multiple executives
* Compile and submit monthly expense reports, managing receipts and other documentation, while adhering to corporate policies on T&E
* Maintain relationships with your executives’ most important external stakeholders, communicating with them over multiple channels
* Stay up-to-date on company happenings and priorities for the Product & Technology org at large, keeping your finger on the pulse of the organization's needs
* Provide coverage for the EA team when needed to ensure our top executives always have support present
* Assist with coordination of events, team outings, socials, onboarding; taking on ad-hoc projects as needed, proactively anticipating and solving problems
  

III. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | *All must be met to be considered.*
Experience: Experience in an Executive or Administrative Assistant role
Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* Proven technical capabilities in Apple iOS and G-Suite; Concur, Egencia and related systems are a plus
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills are core talents of yours
* You have a natural sense of calm under pressure
* You thrive when you find solutions to tough problems
* Able to anticipate needs and work autonomously without much direction but also a team player
* You are the gatekeeper at all times
* You possess an innate drive to delight and exceed expectations
* You have a thirst for knowledge and a strong desire to learn about the business you support

It is the policy of Dotdash Meredith to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Company will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Accommodation requests can be made by emailing ddm.hr@dotdashmdp.com.
The Company participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here: https://www.e-verify.gov/employees
Pay Range
Hourly: New York: $40.00 - $48.40
The pay range above represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position and may change in the future. Actual pay may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to work location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Dotdash Meredith’s total compensation package for employees. Other compensation may include annual bonuses, and short- and long-term incentives. In addition, Dotdash Meredith provides to employees (and their eligible family members) a variety of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, unlimited paid time off (PTO), adoption or surrogate assistance, donation matching, tuition reimbursement, basic life insurance, basic accidental death & dismemberment, supplemental life insurance, supplemental accident insurance, commuter benefits, short term and long term disability, health savings and flexible spending accounts, family care benefits, a generous 401K savings plan with a company match program, 10-12 paid holidays annually, and generous paid parental leave (birthing and non-birthing parents), all of which may vary depending on the specific nature of your employment with Dotdash Meredith and your work location. We also offer voluntary benefits such as pet insurance, accident, critical and hospital indemnity health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance.
#NMG#

title: Logistics Expert - Mineral Resources Trading
description:
**Purpose of the Position/Job Summary:**  

RtM (Americas), Mitsubishi International Corporation’s Precious Metals Division and Non-Ferrous Metals Division, trades precious metals (gold, silver, platinum, palladium, rhodium, iridium, ruthenium), aluminum, copper. RtM stands for “Resources to Market”, and RtM literally trades mineral resources such as various metals and provides industrial customers with them on a global basis. RtM has offices in Singapore, Japan, China, Thailand, India, the UK, and the US. RtM (Americas) has a strong market share and presence in North America in the mineral resources trading industry.
  
  

The Logistics Expert is responsible for independently completing delivery-related operations following contract conclusions by the Front Office, overseeing the importation and domestic operations of non-ferrous metals, and working with North American suppliers and customers. Key duties include monitoring and controlling inventory credit exposure, conducting monthly reconciliations, periodical inspections, and ensuring swift metal movement through close coordination with traders and logistics companies. This role also involves routine logistics activities such as coordinating shipping schedules, chartering transport, handling insurance arrangements, and managing claims settlements. Additionally, the Logistics person will facilitate financial closing, risk monitoring, and contribute to operational efficiency improvements while continuously exploring optimal logistic services and proposing efficient delivery methods.
  
  

**Key Accountabilities:**  

* Complete all delivery-related operations following the contract conclusion of the Front Office.
* Handle US domestic professional operations of non-ferrous metals including importation, working with North American suppliers and customers.
* Perform routine logistic activities including checking the shipping schedule with counterparties, processing quantity declarations to suppliers, coordinating truck and vessel chartering, managing good receipt and release, collecting shipping documents, arranging freight, conducting warehouse rate negotiations, handling insurance arrangements and claims settlements, and working closely with traders and Back Office staff.
* Oversee delivery invoicing, shipping documents, etc. from suppliers and logistics companies
* Provide support to Back Office team on how to process deliveries smoothly and efficiently.
* Monitor and control inventory credit exposure and carry out monthly inventory reconciliation while conducting periodic physical inventory inspection.
* Initiate logistical works such as metal receipt, metal release, metal allocation, and delivery management etc. in conjunction to physical metal trading.
* Continuously explore and identify optimal logistic services, including freight options, through a network of logistic companies.
* Prepare and propose the most efficient delivery methods as needed by Division Managers, the Division Vice President, and other traders.
* Facilitate financial closing and risk monitoring including monthly delivery status check, monthly inventory reconciliation, inventory inspection, warehouse credit line monitoring together with traders and credit risk manager.
* Oversee inventory at each assigned location.
* Conclude necessary contracts with warehouse companies and customers for inventory management.
* Prepare necessary documentation, and support UCC filings working in collaboration with Middle Office, Credit and Front Office managers.
* Contribute to operational efficiency by identifying practical improvements and consulting with team members, including the Division Manager, to implement changes.


**Key Qualifications - REQUIRED:**  

3 to 5 years prior logistic assistant or trade assistant experience
  
  

**Qualifications - PREFERRED:**  

3 to 5 years prior logistic experience especially international import/export logistics operation of container and bulk shipment
  
Bachelor’s degree
  
  

About Mitsubishi International Corporation
  
Mitsubishi International Corporation ("MIC") offers high-value-added services in a broad range of business fields. MIC's primary businesses are related to global trading of industrial and consumer products, complex project management, and strategic finance and investment. Other important functions of MIC include marketing, distribution, materials procurement, technology transfer, product sourcing, and supply chain management.
  
  

Mitsubishi Corporation Group Companies have had a presence in the United States since 1954 when Mitsubishi International Corporation ("MIC") was incorporated as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi Corporation.
  
  

Compensation
  
The expected base salary for this New York, New York, United States-based position is $88,471.30 - $110,040.50. In addition to base salary, this position is eligible for participation in the company’s short-term incentive program. Compensation decisions are dependent on the specific details and circumstances of each hire, such as experience, skills, and education.
  
  

Benefits
  
MIC is committed to providing competitive benefits and wellness offerings. A summary of our benefits, which are generally available to active, non-temporary, full-time US employees who work at least 30 hours per week, can be found here:
  
https://mcaconnected.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/MCAMIC-Benefits-Summary-Sheet-2024.pdf
  
  

MIC follows a hybrid schedule working in-office three days a week and remotely for the rest of most positions. Our in-office time is used primarily for team meetings and formal and informal collaboration.

title: Housing Search Case Manager
description:
**Do you want to work in a friendly, professional and supportive organization? Do you have a desire to serve those who bravely served our country? If so,** **COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**4 WEEKS Paid-Time Off!, Birthday Holiday PLUS MORE!****~Hope for Veterans Program. ~****Shift****: Monday-Friday: 10am-6pm or 11am-7pm**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Assisting veterans with finding affordable, safe, and stable permanent housing in the community upon discharge from the Hope for Veterans Program. Flexible hours, including evenings and an ability to travel within the service delivery areas are required.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* Provides non-clinical case management services including intake, assessment, housing stabilization, budgeting, financial entitlements/benefits, etc.
* Provide supportive counseling for veterans in need of crisis intervention and emergency services
* Support veterans in their recovery through psychoeducation groups, housing search and placement, and linkage to community-based services
* Develop Individual Recovery Plans (IRP) with veterans that adhere to VA Grant & Per Diem guidelines.
* Provides housing search services and support to all veterans with an upcoming discharge date.
* Provides advocacy, linkage, and referrals for permanent housing. May meet with veterans in the community in the course of service delivery.
* Acts as a mediator between veteran and landlords, realtors, real estate brokers, housing authority personnel, and any other housing professionals.
* Develops and nurtures relationships with landlords invested in supporting veterans. Liaison with other community and governmental agencies, landlords, real estate agents, and real estate brokers.
* Assists veterans with applications for housing subsidies and/or rental assistance.
* Assists veterans with coordinating move in and securing necessary household essentials through low cost connections.
* Function as a team member including emergency shift coverage, communicating all relevant information to other team members, covering co-workers’ duties as needed.
* Transports veterans in agency vehicles in a safe, cautious and responsible manner.
* Documents service delivery and maintains accurate, timely, and detailed records.


**Qualifications:**

  

* Bachelor Degree required - and a major in Social Work, Psychology or a related field preferred. However if major is in another field, then work experience will be strongly considered.
* 1-year of prior experience in housing services required, preferably in working with veterans.
* Prior experience in community outreach, marketing, or communication preferred.
* Must possess a valid driver’s license, with a good driving record.


*VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Request Priority Protected Veteran Referral. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Contact.*

title: CMS - Pack Out Teller
description:
With a network of nearly 200 branches, Loomis armored transportation, cash management centers, and cash inventory vaults keep cash flowing throughout financial institutions and retail businesses across the US. Loomis prides itself on providing employees with opportunities for career advancement and job satisfaction. In fact, many of our company’s managers, vice presidents, and corporate executives started out in the branches as driver/guards and tellers. Our work can be challenging, but the thousands who have stayed with our company for decades will tell you that if you have the desire to learn and the drive to succeed, Loomis is the place to be. Come join our team!
  
  

**Job Description:**  

As CMS Pack-out Teller, you will work with your team to ensure the safe and secure preparation of cash and coin for our Loomis customers.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Prepare currency and/or coin change orders by denomination for each customer assigned.
* Must be able to properly count large sums of currency and coin.
* Must be able to decipher change order breakdowns with exact precision to make bags and pack orders.
* Must be able to stand for long periods.
* Must be a team player and be able to work alone.
* Fast-paced position must be able to work and move with purpose.
* Must be able to lift and carry packed orders.
* Other duties as assigned at the discretion of management.


**Requirements:**  

* Ability to read, count, add, subtract, write and record numbers.
* Ability to perform simple computer data entry.


**Working Conditions:**  

* Full-time schedule consists of 40 hours per week
* Work is performed in a room or work area within a vault with little or no exposure to outside light.
* Work is performed standing position.


**Essential Functions/Job Qualifications:**  

As part of the qualification process for the Cash Management Services Teller position, a Human Performance Evaluation (HPE) is required. This evaluation requires successful completion of testing in the following areas:
  
  

**Lift:**  

* 2lbs vertical lift from 36 inches to 52 inches from the floor (15X) - 25lbs vertical lift from 8 inches to 33 inches from the floor (1X) - 18lbs vertical lift from 1 inch to 36 inches from the floor (5X) - 2lbs vertical lift from 7 inches to 62 inches from the floor (17X)


**Lift-Carry:**  

* 30lbs vertical lift from 8 inches to 40 inches from the floor, and horizontally transfer 10ft (1X)


**Push-Pull:**  

* Horizontally transfer 47lbs of force on a sled (single, non-dominant arm), a distance of 1ft (1X)


**Repetitive Coupling:**  

* Squeeze Jamar Hand Dynamometer requiring forces up to 30lbs / both right & left hands (17X each)


Benefits
  
Loomis offers one of the most comprehensive employees benefit packages in the industry, which includes:
  
* Vacation and Sick Time (PTO) as well as Paid Holidays
* Health & Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* 401(k) Plan
* Basic Life Insurance Plan
* Voluntary Life Insurance Plan
* Flexible Spending and Health Savings Account
* Dependent Care Account
* Industry leading Training and Development


Loomis is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
company_description: Loomis is the industry’s leading provider of cash management and cash optimization solutions.

title: Registered Nurse (ICU)
description:
**Position: Registered Nurse (RN)**

**Location: Stamford, CT**

**Specialty: ICU**

**Schedule: 3, 12 hour shifts (7pm to 8am and rotating weekends)**

**Hourly Rate: $45 - $65 (Depending on experience)**

We are looking for a registered nurse to join our nursing staff in providing excellent health care to our patients. Your duty of caring for the patients coming into our facility include tasks like creating and maintaining accurate patient records, administering medication and monitoring for side effects, recording vital signs, and reporting symptoms and changes in patient conditions.

A bachelor's degree in nursing and a state license are essential requirements for consideration. You will also need to be trained in BLS/CPR and be ACLS-certified. A professional, friendly attitude and effective communication skills are keys to becoming successful in this role.

**Registered Nurse Responsibilities:**

* Maintaining accurate, complete health care records and reports.
* Administering medications to patients and monitoring them for side effects and reactions.
* Prescribing assistive medical devices and related treatments.
* Recording patient vital signs and medical information.
* Ordering medical diagnostic and clinical tests.
* Monitoring, reporting, and recording symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
* Administering non-intravenous medications.
* Assessing, implementing, planning, or evaluating patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
* Modifying patient health treatment plans as indicated by patient conditions and responses.

**Registered Nurse Requirements:**

* Bachelor degree or master degree in nursing.
* Pass the National Council Licensure Examination or NCLEX-RN.
* Current state licensure as a registered nurse and BLS certification required.
* American Heart Association BLS/CPR
* ACLS certification
* Ability to effectively communicate with patients, families, physicians and hospital staff.
* Basic computer skills.
* Professional, friendly attitude.
* Experience in home health care.
* Experience in emergency room or intensive care.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Critical & Intensive Care

Physical Setting:

* Hospital

Work Location: In person

title: Supervisor, Social Buying
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is a full-service media agency with capabilities and expertise across all channels and disciplines. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the #1 media buying network in the Americas and #2 globally. As “The ROI Agency,” Zenith’s expertise lies in driving real, tangible business outcomes, not just media metrics, that will have a measurable effect on our clients’ business. Every investment we make has an ROI mindset—not just for our clients, but for our agency at large. We’re focused on driving the maximum value for our people, our capabilities and our media investments for some of the world’s leading brands.

 **Job Description** **Overview:**  

This position requires a highly motivated person to assist in the day-to-day execution of a(n) account(s). The Supervisor will be responsible for activating digital strategic plan development and all aspects of implementation. This individual will learn and embody Zenith’s vision of Live ROI as a mantra and manage several direct reports.

**Role Objectives:**

* Assist with planning and implementation for client accounts across Programmatic and Social campaigns for a Pharmaceutical client
* Plays a leading role in all aspects of campaign management including, campaign setup, vendor liaison and reporting
* Training/Support for Assistant Planners in billing, reporting, trafficking, analytics and research
* Complete campaign management deliverables through hands-on keyboard tasks while managing ad hoc requests
* Assist in presentation of data, insights and media to clients
* Intimate knowledge of consumer habits & touchpoints, i.e. magazine, digital mobile, social, video
* Craft knowledgeable and relevant POVs that assess media opportunities and place appropriate value
* Manage Vendor Billing: insertion orders, monthly billing reports, discrepancy resolution, and reconciliations
* Assist supervisor in negotiation of Buys, Makegoods, Positioning, Value Add Negotiations
* Draw actionable insights based off platform and third-party data through reporting dashboards
* Build relationships with vendors to analyze value and applicability of media vehicles for client media plan
* Create dynamic presentations that effectively communicate to our clients
* Maintain a knowledge of all ad serving platforms: GCM
* Prepare and deliver buying and or digital trafficking specs and guidelines
* Continuously search for opportunities to be positive and to share the positive side to every situation

  

**Qualifications** **Minimum Qualifications:**

* B.A. or B.S. in Marketing, Advertising or related field
* 3+ years of digital media buying/planning experience
* Experience planning digital campaigns for products in both the B2C space and ability to confidently present these to clients both on the phone and in-person
* Must have excellent verbal/written communication skills, interpersonal skills, detail-orientation, follow-though skills
* Must have strong analytical, research, and quantitative skills
* Must be hard-working, resourceful and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, formulas, v-lookup, conditional formats, pivot tables, etc.
* Must possess/develop a strong understanding of the pharmaceutical marketplace including awareness of key publishers, products and trends
* Experience in Meta and TikTok required; Snapchat, Reddit, Linkedin and TTD preferred as well.
* Experience with Prisma and DCM preferred
* Experience with Research tools such as Nielsen, Comscore preferred

 **Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $70,000 - $90,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/8/2024.
