description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** 21st CCLC Afterschool Course Leader
  

**Department** Cornwall Ctr Metro Studies
  

**Salary** Commensurate With Experience
  

**Posting Summary**
Promise Youth University , 21st Century Community Learning Center (PYU-21st CCLC) Afterschool is currently seeking passionate and energetic teachers to lead interactive academic enrichments courses for Grades 3-8th that will enhance student skill mastery, including critical thinking, math principles, and reading comprehension and mechanics through creative activities. Teachers are responsible for developing lesson plans, managing classrooms, ensuring the safety of students, and facilitating the daily implementation of courses. A background or expertise in a course subject area is preferred; training will be provided for some courses. If you are skilled in the areas identified and can positively engage children, our scholars need you!  

  

Position Expectations  

* Attend mandatory 2- week training in the fall semester.
* Provide active and direct supervision to students, ensuring all students are learning in a safe and productive environment
* Employ positive youth development and engagement strategies to connect with youth and foster positive behavior.
* Assist students with homework.
* Organize supplies and resources for course activities.
* Develop engaging programming that is culturally relevant and competent, and developmentally appropriate.
* Submit lesson plans for enrichment courses and workshops, with the support of the Site Coordinator.
* Evaluate and document students’ progress.

  

Course Leaders will begin onsite at Thirteenth Avenue School immediately 3:00pm. Teachers will be dismissed at 4:20pm  

  

About Us
PYU -21st CCLCis a sponsored by the Joseph C. Cornwall Center at Rutgers University Newark. PYU 21st CCLC is funded by New Jersey Department of Education, Nita M. Lowey 21st Century Community Learning Center Grant and the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs.. The mission of Promise Youth University is to provide elementary and middle school scholars with a safe and supportive space outside of school hours to engage in high quality activities that increase their exposure and confidence in science, technology, engineering, arts, and math (STEAM) subjects; and ultimately position scholars for college and career success. The program serves 130 scholars in grades third through eighth, including scholars with special needs during the hours of 2:55pm-6:00pm.

The Rutgers Center for Advanced Infrastructure and Transportation (CAIT) invites applications for one Postdoctoral Associate position.

title: Program Coordinator
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Coordinator
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** The Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Program Coordinator for the Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies, located in New Brunswick, NJ  

  

Under the direction of the Faculty Lead for the Tobacco Industry Marketing Program, the Program Coordinator coordinates and supervises day-to-day operations of the Tobacco Industry Marketing program and various tobacco related research projects in the Institute for Nicotine and Tobacco Studies (INTS). This position will provide high level administrative and research support, which meets high quality standards, taking a leadership role in program oversight, planning and development, and coordinating tasks among research personnel and assuring progress toward deliverables.  

  

Duties include:* Oversees the day-to-day operations of the Tobacco Industry Marketing program under the direction of the Faculty Lead for the Tobacco Industry Marketing (TIM) program
* Oversees the development and production of the weekly TIM Alert, including management of MailChimp subscription services
* Oversees the archive management and image processing for various TIM program dissemination channels (e.g., website, social media)
* Conducts routine surveillance of advertising materials across various platforms (social media, Kantar/Vivvix, Mintel)
* Provides training and supervision of research assistants assigned to TIM program projects to facilitate quality control of data coding as well as dissemination products

**Minimum Education and Experience**
  

**Certifications/Licenses**

* Master’s Degree in a social science or public health field (Public Health preferred) plus four (4) years of postgraduate experience.
* Experience with quantitative and qualitative research methods required. Experience with SPSS, SAS and/or STATA software
* Equivalent experience, education and/or training may be substituted for the education requirements.

title: Unit Secretary
description:
**The Actors Fund Home**, an assisted living, skilled nursing, accredited dementia care and sub-acute rehabilitation center located in Englewood, NJ, and a recipient of a *CMS Five Star Rating* seeks a Full-Time **Unit Secretary** to perform clerical & secretarial day to day duties and maintain medical records **JOB DUTIES:**

* Screen and direct all incoming persons and telephone calls promptly and accurately; answers routine telephone inquiries.
* Ensure that the call bell system is answered promptly.
* Responsible for purchasing and maintaining par levels of medical supplies for the Nursing department and for the processing of invoices.
* Assist Nursing department in coordinating re-admissions for the Nursing Home and Broadway on Hudson by asking hospital/discharging facility for medical records
* Circulate these records to the Nursing Supervisor and Pre-Admission group
* Assemble charts for resident admissions and re-admissions; keeps charts organized
* Prepare paperwork when 911 is called for a resident; and assists the nurse with any other necessary emergency protocols.
* Ensure all discharged charts contain necessary signatures from the interdisciplinary care team
* Ensure information is as outlined by current Nursing Home guidelines, is included.
* Make sure discharged charts are completed, and then scan them to Docuware.
* Assist nursing with scheduling of x-ray procedures, lab pickups and scheduling of doctor appointments for residents.
* Perform audits as directed by the DON with nursing equipment and supplies.
* Perform other job duties as directed by the DON.

 **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* A high school diploma or equivalency certification
* At least 2 years of experience working in healthcare.
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office.
* Possess effective interpersonal skills in dealing with residents, co- workers, families and various health professionals.
* Be adaptable to change and be able to deal with emergencies.
* Frequently pushes, twists, stoops, bends, climbs stairs, reaches at above or below shoulder height. Must be tactful and courteous with residents, families, practitioners, co-workers and others
* Must be able to lift, move, and carry supplies up to 25lbs
* Must be able to work beyond the normal working hours and on weekends and holidays when necessary

 **OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Have an understanding of, affection for, and a desire to work with the aging.
* Some knowledge of medical terminology preferred.

 **ABOUT THIS POSITION**


This is a full-time hourly position based in The Actors Fund Home in Englewood, NJ. The successful candidate must be able to cover assigned shifts as needed, including holidays.


The Actors Fund offers a competitive salary, as well as a comprehensive benefits package, including: choice of multiple health and dental plan options, voluntary vision, flex and dependent care plans, employer-paid life and long-term disability insurance, supplemental life and disability, 401(k) plan with generous employer match, tuition reimbursement, and generous paid time off.

 **TO APPLY**


Click the blue Apply button. A complete application will include a resume and salary expectations.

 **ABOUT THE ACTORS FUND**


The Actors Fund is a national human services organization that fosters stability and resiliency, and provides a safety net for performing arts and entertainment professionals over their lifespan. Through offices in New York, Los Angeles and Chicago, The Fund serves everyone in film, theatre, television, music, opera, radio and dance with programs including social services and emergency financial assistance, health care and insurance counseling, housing, and secondary employment and training services.

title: Mental Health Clinician
description:
Family Services of Westchester, Inc. (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. Serving 30,000 people a year, including 20,000 children, with nearly 50 innovative programs, including counseling, education and support, FSW is a pillar of health in the Westchester community, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Family Services of Westchester’s seven Family Mental Health Program Centers are licensed by the New York State Office of Mental Health to offer comprehensive mental and behavioral health services at convenient locations throughout Westchester County.

Each Family Mental Health Center is staffed by a highly trained team of social workers, psychologists and psychiatrists who are committed to offering confidential, customized care that’s tailored to your (and your family’s) needs. **Our Family Centers offer therapy in English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Swedish, German, Farsi and more.** Our professionals are highly trained to deal with conditions like depression and anxiety, as well as sensitive issues like aging, chronic illness or disability that may be negatively affecting you or your family.

**JOB DETAILS:**

Family Services of Westchester is currently seeking a **Mental Health Clinician for the Family Mental Health Program** in Mt Vernon, NY.

**POSITION TITLE:** Mental Health Clinician

**STATUS:** Full-time

**SUPERVISED BY:** Program Director

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES:**

* Provide individual, family, and group counseling based on clinical diagnosis and assessment of the clients presenting problems within an outpatient mental health setting.
* Accurately document all clinical interventions, diagnoses, symptoms, and presenting problems in the Electronic Medical Record.
* Provide high-quality evidence-based treatment using a variety of modalities including trauma systems therapy and substance use disorder interventions.
* Participate in weekly supervision, multi-disciplinary team meetings, service training programs.
* Provide crisis counseling, linkages to concrete and wraparound service, and coordinate with other providers to better serve the needs of students and families.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Master’s Degree in Social Work, Mental Health Counseling, or Marriage and Family Therapy (MSW, MHC, or MFT)
* LMSW, LMHC, or LMFT preferred with current New York State registration and license as a Licensed Master of Social Work (LMSW) or corresponding degree
* CASAC a plus

**SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Excellent clinical experience with mentally ill, substance abuse afflicted population
* Desire to work in underserved communities
* Outstanding clinical, assessment, and diagnostic skills
* Proficient in the use of computers, and specifically with electronic medical records
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a culturally diverse population
* Team-focused collaborator
* Passionate about providing high-quality care to low-income, underserved residents in a mental health setting
* Excellent interpersonal skills both verbally and in writing
* Highly organized, self–directed
* Engaged in learning and continuous quality improvement
* Resilient

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, 403(b) and generous paid time off.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and this position speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please complete the online application on Indeed.com, upload your resume and cover letter with salary requirements. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*Family Services of Westchester is* *an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $61,000.00 - $73,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Addiction Medicine

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Master's (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* LMSW, LMHC, or LMFT (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: FSW is a nonprofit organization providing Westchester County with a vast range of social and mental health services that strengthen and support individuals at every stage of the life cycle.

title: General Showroom Manager
description:
### **About The Role**

**Role: General Showroom Manager in Waiting**


As Wren Kitchens continues to grow, we are now looking for General Managers 'In Waiting' to join us across southern CT, to help open new locations. You will train as a GM in preparation for your showroom opening. As a GM in Waiting you will need to travel to various other locations to complete your training.



The General Manager, your primary role will be to oversee all aspects of the customer experience within the showroom environment. This includes engaging with customers, generating leads, guiding them through the design process, obtaining sign-offs, coordinating pre-installation activities, and ensuring successful delivery and installation of products.



You will play a pivotal role in leading and coaching the showroom team to achieve sales targets and maintain high service standards. Your responsibilities will extend to upholding showroom presentation standards, ensuring process compliance and embodying company values. Your leadership within the showroom will serve as inspiration to your team.



You will earn a base salary of $70,000 annually with uncapped commission potential, leading to an OTE (On-Target Earnings) of $100,000+

### **About You**

  



**What You Will Bring to Wren:**


Your experience will have been gained in a sales focussed, target driven retail environment, with 5+ years experience in team management, as an assistant, department or general manager. You will have proven experience in leading sales teams and driving them to reach goals.
Kitchen or relevant industry experience is preferred, however exceptional candidates from related industries are encouraged to apply.



The position is for 40 hours a week across 7 days, including weekends and evenings as needed. The ability to travel for training and development is also required.

  

**What Wren Offer:**



A full time position, with amazing earning potential with UNCAPPED commission, health, dental and vision, 15 days PTO and 5 paid sick days, plus 7 federal holidays, and fully paid training.


### **About The Company**



At Wren Kitchens we offer affordable luxury kitchens, proudly manufactured in the USA. We are more than just a kitchen manufacturer; we know that the kitchen is the heart of the home, where families gather, meals are shared, and memories are made.


Our unprecedented growth in the USA means that we are actively seeking outstanding individuals to join our retail showroom teams. If you're passionate about making a difference, and thrive in a collaborative environment, then Wren Kitchens is the place for you.
company_description: Since our launch in 2009, we have amassed the UK's most extensive collection of kitchen products, becoming one of the country's top kitchen retailers.

title: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS
description:
The position of Director of Operations is exempt from the overtime provisions of the Federal Fair Labor Standards Act and shall not be entitled to overtime compensation for hours worked in excess of 40 in any one work week.


The Director of Operations will help drive change, lead the warehouse, inventory control, and transportation functions of the operations, must be willing to take ownership and dedicate the time needed to complete departmental and company-wide objectives, and be part of the long-term growth of the company.


The Director of Operations shall be accountable to, and supervised by, the General Manager.

**Essential Job Functions:**


Directs and oversees the overall operations and site management of the distribution center. Implements and ensures that procedures are followed to provide a safe, efficient, service-oriented, and cost-effective operation.

* **Site leadership:** The Director of Operations will have responsibility for overall site management across the warehouse, inventory control, transportation, and maintenance for safety, people, quality, and cost.
* **Team Management:** Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* **Planning and Directing:** Establish long-term operations objectives that are aligned with business goals. Develop and execute a strategic plan for the operations department. Integrate the separate activities of shipping, receiving, transportation, purchasing, and sales by discussing with each function accountabilities and interdependence in achieving company goals. Participate in the establishment of overall distribution center business goals.
* **Profitable Operations:** Plan, organize, direct, and control the course of operations by integrating and coordinating operations functions and processes with business goals. Maintain profitable operations by controlling inventory, losses, accidents, and safety, etc. Seek synergies and best practices to develop and implement new methods to improve productivity or improve customer service.
* Safety and Compliance: Guide operations management in compliance with government and other regulatory agency guidelines and laws and Company programs. Implement programs to ensure overall safety, security, maintenance, and ergonomics for the operations functions.
* **Personnel and Company Policy:** Delegate responsibility to managers to accomplish productivity goals. Enforce company/distribution center policies on safety and employee discipline by following guidelines, communicating changes to the workforce, and overseeing work and performance of warehouse, inventory control, transportation, and maintenance associates. Create performance improvement plans, administer discipline, and identify training opportunities when appropriate.
* Other duties assigned by the GM.

 **Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, logistics, or a related field and/or 5+ years of related work experience.
* Able to meet fixed deadlines and manage under pressure.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent leadership, negotiation, and organizational skills.
* Capacity to communicate intimately with others.
* Ability to motivate transport and warehouse staff members.
* Capability to handle shifting and multiple priorities efficiently and effectively.
* Must have sturdy problem-solving skills.
* Strong computer skills inclusive of Microsoft Excell, WMS, TMS, etc.

 **Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* MBA and/or 10+ years of job-related experience.
* Ability to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.
* Position will require frequent walking, standing, lifting, and bending.
* Must maintain a valid Driver’s License.

  

Ferraro Foods is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: English Language Arts
description:
**About us**

Booktastic NY is a boutique academic institute in Tenafly, NJ. We believe that students' reading, writing, speaking, and discussion skills can be improved and refined through strategically designed teaching materials. To achieve this, we have developed our own textbooks to help students better enjoy and comprehend literature, including English novels and non-fiction articles covering various themes and subjects. We welcome any positive suggestions or criticism that can improve the quality of our textbooks, as they exist to teach students to their fullest potential.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Work-from-home days
* Growth opportunities

**English Language Arts Teacher**

**Booktastic NY is seeking a part-time, in-person English Language Arts Teacher. Our headquarter is located in Seoul, South Korea, but this tutoring position is for our newly opened Learning Center in the Tenafly, NJ area.**

We currently have an immediate opening for a teacher position, which requires teaching kindergartners to 8th-grade students in-person at the learning center. The hours for this position may vary week-to-week based on the instructional needs of the center.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Preferably previous teaching experience with students who are at or below grade level, with a focus on literacy, language arts, or social studies
* Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, and supervisors
* Strong writing and editing skills
* Ability to work well in a team environment, as well as independently
* Must be comfortable reading and preparing curriculum materials and maintaining classroom protocols
* Must be comfortable working with students who have learning disabilities or other academic difficulties.
* A bachelor's degree is preferred.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide one-to-one and small group (up to 4 or 6 per class) instruction, both in-person and/or online
* Make and implement specific lesson plans under the direction of Booktastic NY leadership
* Provide written feedback and corrections on students' writing and speaking performances
* Manage students' development processes and records electronically using a computer

If you wish to apply for this position, please send your resume to our email address. If you have questions about the position and us, please feel free to contact us at the same email address.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* After school
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Tenafly, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director, Strategy
description:
**Company Description**  

PHM is the leading health media agency in the US. We are designed for—and dedicated to—delivering solutions that connect people with meaningful health and wellness solutions every day. Guided by our genuine passion for health and wellness, our work across the entire media ecosystem helps patients navigate the most important moments of their healthcare journeys.


While we have grown to be the No. 1 agency in our industry, at heart we’re still a startup. It’s that energy and spirit of innovation that allows us to create bold and meaningful “health media firsts” for our clients, and to do it all with #phmlove.

 **Job Description**  

The **Director, Strategy** defines daily functional management of client needs and lead the daily work of the Strategy team. You will report to either the Director, Strategy or VP, Strategy.


This is a hybrid role, requiring three days in-office each week. If you are contacted for an interview, your recruiter will discuss specifics with you, inclusive of any necessary reasonable accommodations.

**Your Impact:**

* You will be one of the critical client leads overseeing the media strategy
* You will have in-depth understanding of the role of media channels in a plan
* You will further develop your expertise in different media research tools
* You will provide support the VP, Strategy and other senior leaders in the planning
* You will manage a team of direct and a larger team of indirect reports managing them in:
	+ Onboarding
	+ Performance Management’
	+ Provide training processes and tools
	+ Manage and delegate team workload
	+ Coach team to achieve client and agency requests
* You will manage multiple accounts and will transition between them conducting the following activities:
	+ You will be accountable to the team’s deliverables and outcomes
	+ You will provide the initial feedback on media strategies, timelines, and deliverables in partnership with other teams
	+ You will provide input to client to help shape their marketing priorities
	+ You will develop a daily relationship with appropriate clients on assigned brands
	+ You will oversee overall media strategy, approach, and plan on each account
	+ You will manage the media channel mix and initial budget allocation & rationale
	+ You will represent the interests of other capability teams in client and agency partner meetings
* You will collaborate with internal leaders to ensure strategic agreement of deliverables with client needs
* Push for continuous improvement of self, team, and client deliverables
* You will be responsible for organic growth efforts on your account and may be asked to help with new business efforts

  

**Qualifications**  

* 7-8+ years media planning experience·
* 3+ years management experience
* 2+ year of cross-channel media planning experience·
* Familiarity with standard media research and planning tools (e.g. Clear Decisions)·
* 1+ years previous pharma media experience, across a diverse set of conditions, disease states, and audiences (DTC, HCP, Payer)

  

**Additional Information**  

Our Publicis Groupe motto “Viva La Différence” means we’re better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on encouraging belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.


Publicis Groupe provides inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and allow every person to grow. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, and parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.


If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $119,000-$137,000 This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.

title: ASSISTANT MERCHANT
description:
**FULLBEAUTY Brands™** is the premier fashion and lifestyle destination for the plus size customer. We are an online and catalog marketplace offering a curated collection of the finest family of plus size brands and thousands of products. **POSITION SUMMARY:**
Reporting to the Senior Merchant, this position will support assigned apparel and/or accessory categories for the brand. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical, strategic thinking and problem-solving skills. The candidate will quickly adapt to differing and fast-paced environments while exuding enthusiasm and flexibility when collaborating cross-functionally to achieve set goals.
The successful candidate will bring a “roll up the sleeves” and “can do attitude”. **PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Understand the ELOQUII customer while delivering the optimal assortment and web experience
* Ensure appropriate product mix and inventory levels to maximize sales
* Works closely with design, marketing, creative, and vendors to bring the online assortment to life
* Consistently pattern the competitive market
* Maintain site performance metrics, benchmarks, and web merchandising best practices
* Manage the site daily to increase all metrics including conversion, AOV, AUR, and UPT
* Execute initiatives to ensure the best shopping experience for the customer
* Analyze product performance data and merchandise the site accordingly
* Assist Senior Merchandise Manager in the reporting of business results and Key Performance Indicators

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:*** Bachelor's degree in Fashion Merchandising or equivalent experience
* 0-1 year of experience in retail merchandising at the intern or assistant merchant level
* Effective decision-making skills and excellent organizational skills
* Entrepreneurial drive
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to partner with team members across different internal functions.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Microsoft Excel; Demandware is a plus.

**WHY JOIN FULLBEAUTY?*** Competitive Health Benefits (Medical, Dental & Vision)
* Employer HSA Contribution
* 401K Match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Hybrid Work Schedule (Corporate)
* Business Casual Attire
* Wellness Initiatives
* 30% Associate Merchandise Discount Across our Family of Brands
* Employee Discount on Travel, Cell Phone Plans and More
* Generous Paid Time Off Program
* Promote From Within Culture
* Commitment to Being an Equal Opportunity Employer
* Life Insurance Benefits
* Internal charity that supports FULLBEAUTY Brands’ associates and their immediate family members during times of extreme hardship

 **FULLBEAUTY Brands™** is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Guest Services Associate | Full Time | Overnight
description:
Join Our Team as a Guest Service Associate at HI USA New York City Hostel!  

Would you love to interact with travelers from all around the world and welcome them to your city? Join Hostelling International USA at our vibrant NYC hostel, located in the Upper West Side. We are currently accepting applications for a full time overnight Guest Service Associate who will play a crucial role in creating a welcoming atmosphere while ensuring the reception desk runs smoothly, efficiently, and in accordance with hostel policy.  

Position Details:  

Pay: $18.85 - $19.23 per hour (+$1/hour differential for overnight hours)
Shifts: Combination of PM (4pm-12:30am) and overnight (11 pm-8:30 am), Flexiblity to work both is required
Type: Full-time, benefit-eligible
Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, disability, vacation, sick leave, 403b with company match, and more (New Hire waiting periods apply).  

Perks:* Free stays at other HI USA hostels (subject to availability)
* Discounts on hundreds of brands
* On-the-job training
* Opportunities for growth within HI USA
* Friendly and inclusive work environment

  

Responsibilities:* Welcome, register, orient, and supervise guests, providing group orientations with cultural sensitivity
* Handle individual and group reservations via telephone, email, or online
* Conduct hostel tours and gather guest feedback
* Follow procedures to ensure the security and safety of the hostel, guests, and staff
* Maintain shift reports, logs, and daily paperwork, including overnight fees, sales, and rentals
* Perform various tasks including laundry, cleaning, bookkeeping, and food preparation
* Provide information on HI memberships, the hostel, and local area to guests
* Promote HI USA's mission: “To help all, especially the young, gain a greater understanding of the world and its people, through hostelling”
* Positively represent HI USA to guests, callers, and local officials
* Provide overnight, on-call assistance for emergencies
* Perform other duties as assigned by management

  

Skills/Qualifications:* High school diploma or GED
* Preferred: Customer service experience, hostelling experience, and the ability to speak a second language
* Excellent communication skills and ability to handle cash accurately
* Enjoy working with the public; able to calmly and professionally handle conflicts, guest issues, or emergencies
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and work independently or as part of a team
* Computer literacy (WINXP, MS Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Willingness to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as required
* Preferred: First aid and CPR certification (training can be provided)

  

Physical Requirements:* Regularly required to sit, use hands and arms
* Frequently required to stand, walk, talk, and hear
* Occasionally required to climb or balance
* Must be able to lift and move up to 50 pounds
* Specific vision abilities required: close, peripheral, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
* Noise level in the work environment is usually moderate

 *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*  

We Make a Difference!


At HI USA, we celebrate diversity and welcome individuals of all backgrounds. As a nonprofit organization, we help people, especially the young, travel on a budget to foster a greater understanding of the world and its people through affordable travel opportunities. If you're passionate about hospitality and creating memorable experiences, apply today to join our team.

  

Want to see what a day in the life at HI USA looks like? Follow us on TikTok!

title: Brand Manager
description:
**WHO WE ARE**
Nogin is a technology company that specializes in one-stop end-to-end customized eCommerce solutions in the retail space. Our variety of services include site development, creative services, online marketing, customer service, fulfillment among other services that ensure our client’s online success. **THE ROLE**
The Brand Manager drives the day-to-day eCommerce business. This includes but is not limited to coordinating cross-functional teams and projects, planning and delivering the monthly campaigns, product launches, driving site functionality improvements and leads weekly/monthly/quarterly client meetings. Bringing along key stakeholders within the organization, client base, product vendors and third-party partners is fundamental to the Brand Manager executing a robust digital strategy. Brand Managers are highly analytical, thoughtful and strategic using data to recommend best practices on site. The Brand Manager is the conductor, orchestrating the digital marketing lead, the buyer/planner, eCommerce coordinators and extended team to drive site traffic and conversion. **WHAT YOU’LL DO*** Execute best practices on site:
	+ Perform site audits to ensure general site health and optimal customer journey.
	+ Drive site updates and new functionality to improve KPIs (AOV, CVR, UPT)
	+ Define and execute merchandising strategies aligned with brand guidelines and revenue targets
	+ Assure all collections and pages have a relevant page title, on-page copy, and meta descriptions
	+ Monitor checkout flow ensuring a seamless experience for shoppers
	+ Driving homepage and navigation updates to align with current product mix and brand messaging
* Execute strategies to hit KPIs and grow eCommerce traffic:
	+ Own campaign and promotional calendar, adjusting as needed to accommodate product launches, supply chain and market conditions.
	+ Have a high-level understanding of digital marketing, collaborating with the marketing manager to identify and explore growth opportunities
	+ Analyze product performance, sell-through velocity to plan to inform product replenishment
	+ Analyze site KPI’s to understand the performance increases and decreases.
	+ Understand previous period performance and market conditions to recommend strategies that consistently exceed client objectives
* Client communication:
	+ Lead client meetings (weekly, biweekly, monthly), prepare meeting decks
	+ Key point person on day-to-day execution
* Works closely with the Digital Director, Digital Marketing Manager, eCommerce Coordinator, Logistics Team, Customer Service Team, Dev Team, Creative Team and Content & Catalog teams
* Leads and manages the eCommerce Coordinator

 **WHO ARE YOU?*** Detail-oriented
* A Dot Connector, able to learn quickly
* Flexible in a fast-paced environment
* Effective Time Manager
* Independent Thinker
* Thoughtful and Mature
* Passionate and Committed
* Highly Communicative and Collaborative
* Analytical and Intellectually Curious
* Extremely organized, able to prioritize projects based on shifting business needs

 **WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED*** 3-5 years’ experience within a digital retail environment
* Demonstrated understanding of retail and eCommerce best practices
* Strong written and verbal presentation skills, inspires confidence and trust at all professional levels
* Working knowledge of eCommerce marketing, including best practices in email, social media, affiliate marketing, display, PPC and SEO
* Knowledge of Project Management and how to effectively drive projects to completion
* Proficient in web analytics tools (i.e. Omniture, GA, CoreMetrics) and MS Office Suite
* System knowledge in an e-commerce platform, ideally Shopify
* Working knowledge of project management tools – Confluence, Jira
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Economics or related field preferred

 **WHAT WE OFFER*** **Health/Benefits:** Full suite of benefits including Medical, Dental, Visual, Life, Paid Vacation, and 401(k).
* **Training:** Excellent opportunities for ongoing education on the latest tools, best practices, and technologies.
* **Work/Life Balance:** We promote a healthy work/life balance and have created a flexible work environment to accommodate people’s needs.

 *Nogin is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.** *While we encourage you to explore the job opportunities at Nogin, we also urge you to be cautious and wary of recruitment scams.*

title: ASSISTANT TEACHER - CHILD CARE CENTER
description:
Felician University is presently seeking a highly motivated professional to support the Lead Teacher in the day-to-day planning of instruction, maintaining student records, daily communication with parents and assisting all volunteers serving the program. The Assistant Teacher will work under the guidance of the Lead Teacher and Executive Director and will utilize approved curriculums for all instructional practices.  

Felician University is committed to maintaining a learning and employment environment based upon our core values of *Respect for Human Dignity*, *Compassion*, *Transformation*, *Justice and Peace, and Solidarity with People in Need.* We offer a choice of medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits, as well as a retirement plan (403B), tuition remission, and generous time off benefits. **Required Education:**
High School Diploma required. **Qualifications:**
3+ years’ of experience in an Early Childhood Program, experience/training/licensure with special populations preferred: willingness and ability to support and promote the Felician Franciscan mission and values of the University. **To Apply:**
Send cover letter, resume and 2 professional references electronically to the Executive Director or via USPS to:  

Mr. Frank Quatrone, Executive Director
Felician University Child Care Center
262 South Main Street
Lodi, New Jersey 07644

title: PER DIEM LITIGATION ATTORNEY WITH TRIAL EXPERIENCE
description:
**PER DIEM LITIGATION ATTORNEY WITH TRIAL EXPERIENCE**

Queens-based law firm is looking for a commercial and tort litigation attorney who is highly experienced in handling litigation until trial. This is a freelance position and a great opportunity for Attorneys who are looking for extra work. The Candidate applying for this Per Diem position should be excellent in conducting legal research, writing memorandum of law, drafting Complaints, Answers, Motions, Counterclaims, Discovery documents, deposits, etc. should be able to make appearances before the Supreme Court in Queens County. The law firm Attorney will be happy to assist with any assistance which will be needed from the Clients end. All Attorneys interested should forward their Statement of Interest or resume to subrato@gehilaw.com

**Job Description & Responsibilities:**

* Handle all aspects of litigation, including depositions, mediations, hearings, and trials
* Manage a litigation caseload from inception to completion, either independently or under the supervision of other attorneys.
* Right education and experience in Tort law.
* Handle personal injury cases, negotiate a fair settlement, and represent yourself in civil court.
* Be able to effectively manage multiple clients and matters
* Conduct excellent legal research and provide thoughtful written analyses of legal questions
* Draft motions and briefs with minimal supervision
* Work closely with other attorneys to provide recommendations for resolving legal issues
* Attend hearings and pretrial conferences
* Provide professional and timely updates on cases to clients
* Develop case strategies and projections

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

License/Certification:

* Bar (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Jackson Heights, NY 11372 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Jackson Heights, NY 11372: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Jackson Heights, NY 11372

title: Warehouse Operator I
description:
JOM Pharmaceutical Services, Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson’s Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Warehouse Operator I located in Somerset, NJ.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.



We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

  

Warehouse Operators are responsible for conducting accurate and timely distribution of pharmaceutical products.

  

Duties and Responsibilities:


* Perform picking, packing, receiving, cycle counting, putting away, and shipping inventory.
* Maintain relationships with distribution and customer service areas, follow regulatory and safety procedures, and perform assignments with necessary technology and equipment.
* Qualified in 75% of their respective operation with knowledge of all SOPs for qualified areas, demonstrates proficiency in performance responsibilities, and knows JOM Distribution Company Policies and Rules.
* Complies with Safety and Health Standards and all rules and regulations, which apply to own actions and conduct. Practices the Stop, Stay, and Resolve initiative when necessary and communicates any follow-ups with a supervisor.
* Operates systems and equipment necessary to process orders, i.e. MARC, ship line, labelers, material moving equipment, and manifest system.
* Assist the Distribution Supervisor with resolving procedural inconsistencies and work with SMEs to provide suggestions and/or corrections.
* Develop, evaluate, implement, and monitor quality management strategies to avoid, exploit, reduce, or transfer issues.
* Demonstrates active participation in the communication process within the team environment as a minute taker or facilitator in mass team meetings, sub-team meetings, communication meetings, safety meetings, etc.
* Take ownership of identifying and solving issues with management.


A pre-identified candidate is being considered for this role. However, all applications will still be considered.

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Minimum High School Diploma or equivalent degree required.
* Minimum of four (4) years of relevant work experience.
* Minimum of six (6) months of work experience within a GXP environment.
* Experience with MARC or Warehouse Management Systems (WMS).
* Basic proficiency in all functions of Microsoft Office.
* Requires capability of becoming Forklift Certified; current certification is a plus.
* Position requires continuous lifting and/or moving lightweight material (5-25 lbs.) and frequent lifting or moving average weight material (25-50 lbs.)
* Requires ability and willingness to flexibly work between the operational hours of 6:30 am - 5:00 pm (EST) four days per week (Monday - Friday), with overtime on weekdays, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Requires up to 10% domestic travel.

  

  

Additional Information:


* The anticipated base pay range for this position is $28,000 to $44,850 annually.
* The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits: - Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

  

  

* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

  

A pre-identified candidate is being considered for this role. However, all applications will still be considered.

  

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

  

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career, and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

This position reports to the A&D Senior Director Portfolio and Program Management. The position will manage, coordinate and complete Acquisitions & Divestitures programs for Johnson and Johnson Technology. In this capacity, the Deal Program Manager will partner with Regional Program managers and Deal Leads to plan and execute A&D projects. The Deal Program Manager will build strategies and define scope, identify and handle multi-functional interdependencies, identify and coordinate the creation of vital program documentation to ensure alignment; develop overall program plan, lead all aspects of successful execution, and track program status and provide updates to the Deal Lead, Global PMO, senior leadership and partners. Supervise detailed plans for A&D activities across the JJT organization to ensure smooth transitions. The role will partner and collaborate with enterprise IT groups and other business functions (IT, HR, Finance, Facilities, etc.) to identify and address interdependencies between the teams, to ensure workstreams deliver per plan and proactively identify and engage JJT and business partners.



Throughout key programs, the incumbent will be responsible for analyzing, planning and handling the program budget and engaging resources.



The role requires active engagement with a variety of organizations within Johnson and Johnson including IT, Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain and Corporate groups to drive successful A&D programs.



Strong interdependent partnering and communication skills are required for the Deal Program Manager to collaborate with many partners outside and within J&J. This position will be expected to run multiple strategic A&D programs concurrently and share updates to senior leadership. The candidate will require a deep understanding of Acquisition and Divestitures, J&J structure, strong execution and delivery skills, and a bias toward problem solving and resolution.



Key Responsibilities:


* For assigned A&D program, define the JJT transition strategy based on the deal type and interdependencies and impact on other workstreams. Collect and consolidate all program plans
* Closely partner with and coach the assigned Project Managers to track and monitor the projects within the program, identify interdependencies, issues/risks and potential mitigations, resources, and lessons learned. Assist deal lead with priorities, issues and escalations
* Provides access to program progress to JJT and business leadership; provides updates to partners as appropriate; be the single source of truth for program status
* Assist in preparing, reviewing and presenting change requests, funding/resource needs or issues requiring decisions from global or regional governance.
* Handle program financials including contingency funds for change requests
* Lead change management & communications efforts related to the A&D activities with appropriate partners.
* Assist in the creation and oversight of all Transition Service Agreements (TSAs) and ensure regional considerations are included
* Collaborate with the Buyer or Seller to ensure there is alignment to successfully meet the TSA exit dates
* Develop short-term/long-term IT strategies to improve A&D execution
* Use and improve portions of JJT A&D playbook and other tools to deliver deals more holistically. Ensure playbook consistency and use of recommended standard methodologies.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Required:


* A minimum of Bachelor’s Degree
* 3-5 years of A&D experience in leading large complex programs.
* At least 3 years of IT experience with business acquisitions or divestitures and integration activities
* Strong proficiency with project management practices, tools and methodologies including financial management
* Strong data analytical skills with experience with Excel modeling, Smartsheet, PowerBI/Tableau reporting
* Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills. Effective collaborator and problem solver.
* Experience / knowledge of cultures across the globe with an Executive presence
* Ability to work under stress and strict timelines. Ability to set-up and facilitate multi-functional meeting to resolve issues in a timely manner
* Models Credo Values – demonstrates strong values, ethics and communication skills that establish a culture of trust and transparency. Build partnering solutions across business and IT
* Good interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written) including the ability to explain technology concepts to business partners
* Demonstrable ability to assemble, prioritize and present large amount of data and publish them concisely, so they are understandable and impactful
* Multi-function experience; understands business processes, end to end business processes impact on project dependencies.


Preferred:


* PMP (Project Management Professional) designation
* 3-5 years of relevant A&D experience with either a management consulting firm, a top-tier tech company, a private equity firm, or an investment bank


Other:


* 20% business travel expected

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000 to $170,200.

title: DIRECTOR ENTERPRISE OPERATIONS
description:
Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Director of Enterprise Operations, located in Raritan, NJ!



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



The Director Enterprise Operations is responsible for the compliant, accurate, and timely execution of enterprise contracts, chargebacks, rosters, contract administration and customer inquiry support across JNJ's Med Tech and Innovative Medicine sectors. The position oversees a team of 30+ professionals and works across a wide range of cross functional internal and external customers.



Key Responsibilities:



The Director of Enterprise Operations is responsible for leading all aspects of:


* The enterprise contract development process of Med Tech Distributors and Consolidated Service Centers (CSCs). The negotiation of these agreements requires frequent communications and interactions at executive levels with Customers, SCG Contract Management, Channel Management, Account Management, Contracting Departments at the Operating Companies, Legal, Finance, IT, and Supply Chain.
* Channel Management Operations team which includes price load and maintenance for our (IM) Acute Care and Med Tech Distributor, and CSC customers.
* Med Tech and Innovation Medicine (IM) chargebacks processes to ensure the accurate and timely processing of chargebacks and the resolution of any associated discrepancies.
* Enterprise Roster Management (ERM) process and resolution of customer inquiries in the Customer Inquiry Support (CIS) team.
* This position may also oversee strategic and cross-functional projects within JJHCS and the franchises to improve or implement enterprise contracting in various areas (i.e.; Overlays, Customer Roster, and Distribution.)
* Overall, this position ensures that there is an efficient contracting process, system, and organization in place to deliver efficient and compliant (upholding Guidance Document, Contract Pricing Committee, and SOX requirements) activities in the areas listed above.


People Management and Development


* The Director of Enterprise Operations reports to the Senior Director of Commercial ECM, a member of the Enterprise Contract Management Leadership Team (ECMLT), charged with providing strategic direction to the organization across multiple channels and functions of the contracting continuum.
* This position owns the people and performance management process for the members of the Enterprise Operations team and provides mentorship, direction, development planning, and performance feedback on a regular basis to team members to ensure effective and productive work teams. The position coaches and mentors future leaders to identify and champion high potential / high performing talent and incorporates into succession planning.
* The Director of Enterprise Operations participates on Industry teams and Councils to gain and keep up with industry knowledge and benchmarks for JJHCS ECM.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Education:


* A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree required. Advanced Degree or MBA preferred.


Experience and Skills:



Required:


* A minimum of 10 years of experience in the healthcare industry
* A minimum of 4 years in contracting, finance, business development or licensing and acquisition experience.
* Ability to work with others at various levels in the organization required.
* Ability to communicate effectively with others, including defending logical business arguments required.


Preferred:


* Experience in contract strategy, offer/contract development, and contract administration preferred.
* Experience in interacting with Customers preferred.
* In depth understanding of Law Department Guidance Documents related to Commercial Contracting preferred.
* Developmental experience and proven success in areas such as Finance, Business Analytics and Offer/Contract Development desirable.
* Understanding of decentralized and cross-functional business models preferred.
* Experience in project management preferred.


Other:


* This position requires a minimum of 10% travel
* The anticipated base pay range for this position is $142,000 to $235,000.


The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year

title: Marketing Manager, NeuWave US
description:
Ethicon US LLC, a member of Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is recruiting for a Marketing Manager, to join our NeuWave business. The role will be preferably based in Raritan, NJ; Cincinnati, OH; or Madison, WI. There will be consideration for a remote setup at the hiring manager's discretion.



Johnson & Johnson



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



The Ethicon Surgical Care business offers a broad range of products, platforms, and technologies—including sutures, surgical staplers, clip appliers, trocars and synthetic mesh devices—that are used in a wide variety of minimally invasive and open surgical procedures. Specialties include support for treatment of colorectal and thoracic conditions, women’s health conditions, hernias, cancer, and obesity.



Learn more about NeuWave at www.NeuWave.com!



Job Summary:



Within the US NeuWave Commercial Organization, the Marketing Manager is a customer-facing role within Marketing responsible for engaging and building productive relationships with clinical thought leaders and other key influencers in the ablation space, with a focus on surgical ablation. This role will be responsible for providing strategic insights gained from key customers, identifying and developing thought leaders in the therapeutic space, leading KOL downstream engagements, society engagements, and working with field selling professionals to enhance our NeuWave Value Proposition to key stakeholders. The role will report directly to the Director of NeuWave Marketing. This individual will be part of a dynamic NeuWave Marketing Team with responsibility for driving alignment and execution of cross functional partners to deliver strategy, implement the tactical plan and achieve business objectives.



Key responsibilities include: engaging with customers and KOLs regarding NeuWave technology to accelerated market adoption and expansion NeuWave technology in the IR and OR



Duties and Responsibilities:


* US Commercial lead for NeuWave 2024 launch.
* Lead financial planning, pricing, contracting, and implementation elements.
* Monitor and control budget to assess promotional effectiveness.
* Work productively with external agencies and cross functional groups within the organization.
* Work cross-functionally (R&D, Commercial Education, Professional Education, Global Strategic Marketing) to establish training and educational materials, value proposition, promotional materials, implementation strategy, remote & in-person support mode
* Lead the compliant development and execution of KOL engagement strategy; this includes identifying KOLs, developing and coordinating an integrated plan that includes contacts and activities across multiple functions, clinical societies, and industry conferences.
* Create an enduring KOL influencer map and devise an actionable KOL engagement model
* Collaborate and support field sales organization, and develop market understanding through engagement with key customers and opinion leaders
* Perform other marketing related activities as assigned in support of the overall NeuWave portfolio and products to surgical customers and interventional radiology customers.
* Ensure applicable company compliance with all relevant regional requirements, company regulations, policies and procedures.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required and an advanced degree preferred
* Minimum 5 years of healthcare industry experience is required
* Experience in customer selling and/or interaction is preferred
* Ability to effectively build customer relationships is required
* Interventional Radiology and OR experience is preferred
* Experience with KOL and faculty development is preferred
* Ability to build leadership relationships and influence in a highly matrixed organization is preferred
* Experience partnering with customers & KOL in the interventional radiology and surgical oncology area(s) is preferred
* Strong communication, collaboration, project management and organizational influence skills are required
* Good interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on leadership, relationship development, and influence management is preferred
* This role may require up to 50% travel in peak times to customer visits, field-based educational events (some occurring on weekends) and other meetings.


The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000 - $170,200



Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Director Occupational Safety
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



Johnson & Johnson is recruiting a Director Occupational Safety. The Director Occupational Safety serves as a key member of the Environment Health & Safety (EH&S) organization.



This position will be located in US or Europe in one of our major MAKE sites.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



SCOPE:

  

The scope of this role will support occupational safety within the different areas of the company operations, including manufacturing, warehousing, distribution, R&D, commercial, and offices. Occupational safety is the discipline of ensuring the safety of employees, contractors, customers, visitors, partners, etc. It involves identifying, assessing, and controlling the hazards and risks that may arise from the work environment, processes, equipment, materials, or activities. Occupational safety aims to prevent injuries and illness.



Specific areas of support include: machine safety, electrical safety, Lock-out/Tag Out/Try Out, Ergonomics, Contractor Safety, EH&S by Design, Human and Operational Performance (HoP), Accident/Incident investigation, Competency/Skill development, share lessons learned from incidents, etc. This list is non-exhaustive and as such a broad general knowledge on Occupational Safety is required.

  

KEY DUTIES:

  

The Director Occupational Safety leads a team of occupational safety matter experts (SME).


* Lead the development of an Occupational Safety strategic plan, and tactical objectives in partnership with EH&S operations leaders and business partners that align with the organization's vision, mission, and values and aligned with the needs of the business.
* Provide operational guidance and hands-on support to ensure efficient and effective execution. Regularly visits key locations and provides direct execution and training support.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness and performance of the Occupational Safety program, and report on Occupational Safety metrics and indicators to senior management and relevant stakeholders.
* Ensure compliance with all applicable Occupational Safety laws, regulations, standards, and best practices, and keep abreast of changes and updates in the Occupational Safety field.
* Establish and maintain Occupational Safety policies, procedures, and guidelines that reflect the organization's Occupational Safety goals and expectations.
* Conduct regular Occupational Safety risk assessments and audits, and identify and prioritize areas for improvement and mitigation.
* Provide Occupational Safety training, education, and awareness to staff and managers, and ensure that they have the necessary knowledge, skills, and competencies to perform their duties safely and effectively.
* Oversee the investigation and reporting of Occupational Safety -related accidents, injuries, and incidents, and ensure that root causes are identified and corrective and preventive actions are implemented, followed up and shared across the organization.
* Scout, test and scale of innovative technologies to support an injury free workplace.
* Engage externally to benchmark and assure J&J stays at the forefront of innovative Occupational Safety solutions as well as to advance J&J’s thought leadership and impact through collaborative partnerships.
* Manage and supervise the Occupational Safety team, and provide them with leadership, direction, and support.
* Manage the Occupational Safety budget and resources, and ensure that they are allocated and utilized efficiently and effectively.
* Build and maintain positive and collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders, such as employees, managers, regulators, insurers, contractors, and suppliers, and represent the organization in Occupational Safety -related matters.


KEY RELATIONSHIPS:

  

The Director, Occupational Safety works with other EHS&S leaders, senior Commercial, R&D and Supply Chain leaders, and key internal partners such as Engineering and Property Services (E&PS), Employee Health and Wellness (EH&W) to promote a culture of safety across the organization.



The director will also interface with Occupational Safety regulatory agencies, professional associations and external experts in the EH&S field.

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Education:


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent level of degree is required. Advanced degree in management and EHS/Engineering technical field preferred
* Focus degree or training in Applied Science E.G. Electronics, Automation is preferred.


Required:


* A minimum of 10 years of occupational safety leadership experience is required, preferable in a Pharma/Medical Device or other highly regulated industry.
* Outstanding leadership; ability to gain trust and influence at all levels in a collaborative manner; act as a great business partner.
* Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to influence behaviors and resolve challenge.
* Demonstrated project management skills and good team skills in working with others at any level or responsibility.
* Track record of strategic thinking and influencing in your part of the business.
* This position may require a 30% of domestic and/or international travel.

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is 142,000 to 244,950.



The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:- Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year

title: Research & Development Leadership Development Program (RDLDP)- 2025 Full Time
description:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for various roles in our Research & Development Leadership Development Program Class of 2025, across various locations in the U.S.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.



We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued, and our people can reach their potential.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

  

At Johnson & Johnson MedTech Companies, for more than a century, with patients at the center and in partnership with those on the front lines, we have harnessed the power of technology and breakthrough innovation to elevate new standards of care. In an increasingly digital world, we are reimagining health – working to expand patient access, improve outcomes, reduce health systems costs, and drive value.



In surgery, orthopaedics, vision, and interventional solutions, we go beyond what’s next to help save lives and create a future where healthcare solutions are smarter, less invasive, and more personalized.

  

What you will do



Our MedTech Research & Development Leadership Development Program (RDLDP) is a two-year dynamic rotational program that offers exciting and unrivaled assignment experiences supporting a wide variety of highly specialized, innovative R&D teams, such as New Product Development, Design, Orthopedic Laboratory Testing, Manufacturing, Design Quality, and Bioengineering.


* You will have opportunities to participate and/or lead in rotational assignments encompassing the entire project or a substantial portion of a major project. This may include resolving advanced materials, process, inspection/testing, or procedural approaches to advance a medical device through the pipeline process into full R&D, and potentially into commercialization.
* Support of products’ design development, manufacturing, and commercialization, leveraging technical expertise to anticipate and proactively address challenges and risks.
* Increase the productivity of product design utilizing CAD, improve the quality of projects, improve communications through documentation, and to create a database for manufacturing.
* Engineer capabilities required to develop and deliver automated medical devices - including requisite instruments, advanced imaging, and user interface/experience.
* Pursue several internal developmental training programs as well as externally recognized qualifications such as Process Design Excellence.
* Opportunity to work in a fast-paced cross-functional, technologically advanced corporate environment in a program focused on developing individual engineers capable of pursuing careers across medical device businesses and high-volume manufacturers.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Currently enrolled in an Engineering Graduate Program ( master’s degree) graduating by June 2025.
* The following engineering disciplines or specialties are preferred: Mechanical, Mechatronics, Robotics, Electrical, Computer, Systems, Software, Computer Science, Materials Science, Biomedical, Optical and Bioinformatics.
* The following concentration fields and/or skills are strongly preferred: Machine Learning, IoT, Embedded Software, Deep Machine Learning, Prototyping, Robot Design, Systems Reliability, Camera Optics, Image quality, Vision or Image Quality Assessment, Firmware, and hardware integration.
* A minimum GPA of 3.3 is strongly preferred.
* Ability to work closely with technical and non-technical personnel and have excellent communication skills with the ability to influence others.
* Ability to demonstrate excellent critical thinking skills, intellectual curiosity, and a dedicated approach to achieving success.
* Validated leadership experience through extra-curricular activities, employment, and/or internship experiences is required. An R&D co-op or internship is highly preferred.
* Ability to relocate anywhere in the United States as required by the program’s rotations – a mandatory requirement.

  

  

Primary Locations:



Massachusetts: Raynham, Boston, Cambridge



Florida: Jacksonville, Miami



Indiana: Warsaw



Ohio: Cincinnati



Pennsylvania: West Chester, Springhouse



Texas: Irving, Houston



New Jersey: Somerville, Skillman, Raritan



California: Irvine, Redwood, Santa Clara, Los Gatos, Milpitas, San Jose, San Diego

  

The anticipated base pay for this position is $97,000/year, this position is eligible for a sign-on bonus.

Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
